auth.name: CloudFlare Helper
auth.description: This is a web assistant for managing domains from different accounts.

home.title: Websites
home.description: Select a domain to configure and monitor how Cloudflare processes its web traffic.

add.title: Connect your domains
add.description: Optimize the security, performance, and reliability of your web traffic.
add.label: Enter an existing domain name (example.com )

ssl.ssl_desctiption: Customize your edge certificates, which encrypt traffic.
ssl.configm_desc_1: You are switching your SSL mode from
ssl.configm_desc_3: Are you sure you want to make that change?
ssl.your_ssl: Your SSL/TLS encryption mode is flexible
ssl.off_desc: No encryption applied. Turning off SSL disables HTTPS and causes browsers to show a warning that your website is not secure.
ssl.flexible_desc: Enable encryption only between your visitors and Cloudflare. This avoids browser security warnings, but all connections between Cloudflare and your origin are made through HTTP.
ssl.full_desc: Enable encryption end-to-end. Use this mode when your origin server supports SSL certification but does not use a valid, publicly trusted certificate.
ssl.full_script_desc: (Recommended mode) Enable encryption end-to-end and enforce validation on origin certificates. Use Cloudflare’s Origin CA to generate certificates for your origin.
ssl.always_use_HTTPS_desc: Redirect all requests with scheme “http” to “https”. This applies to all http requests to the zone.
ssl.min_TLS_desc: Only allow HTTPS connections from visitors that support the selected TLS protocol version or newer.
ssl.TLS13: Enable the latest version of the TLS protocol for improved security and performance.
ssl.automatic_HTTPS_desc: Automatic HTTPS Rewrites helps fix mixed content by changing “http” to “https” for all resources or links on your web site that can be served with HTTPS.

accounts.title: Accounts
accounts.description: On this page, you can view and add Cloudflare accounts.
accounts.confirmation_description: Do you really want to view your account details?
accounts.confirm_count_1: Do you really want to delete
accounts.add_accounts_description: On this page, you can import accounts with your own domains for further management.

settings.change_email_desc: Do you really want to change your email? Current email:
settings.change_password_desc: Do you really want to change your password?
settings.change_telegram_desc: Do you really want to change your telegram?
settings.settings_description: On this page, you can view and edit account information.
settings.Language_preference_desc: My preference for the language shown in the dashboard is:

billing.billing_desctiption: On this page, you can view your top-up history.
billing.billing_desctiption_sub: On this page, you can view your subscription purchase history.
billing.subscriptions_desc: Here are displayed all your top-ups and expenses, except for subscriptions.
billing.balance_desc: You can top up your balance with various cryptocurrencies.
billing.invoices_desc: Here are displayed all your top-ups and expenses, except for subscriptions.

webapp.webapp_desc: This is a web assistant for managing domains from different accounts.
webapp.no_account_1: You are not registered on our website yet, write a command

dns.manager_desc: View, add, and edit DNS records. The changes will take effect after saving.
dns.name: Name
dns.name_servers_desc: Change your name servers or authoritative DNS servers. These are the name servers assigned to you.

tariffs.chooce: Choose the jump you go to
tariffs.tariffs_description: On this page, you can familiarize yourself with the available tariff plans: compare features and prices, choose the optimal option for yourself, and find out the details of each plan.
tariffs.enough_desc: You can purchase a higher tariff rate to be able to perform this action!
